result.execSummary:
The defendant Britton R Saunders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Restitution. Paid in full.
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.
Mental Health / Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Sex offender registration. Participate in sex offender treatment.

No Contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint or their family. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. No Unsupervised contact with anyone under 18 yrs old without agent approval. No possession of pornography or any other explicit materials. No access to any computer or device with internet access without prior approval from agent. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

deny the post conviction motion

Defendant Britton R Saunders in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.   State Public Defender Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel presents statements regarding his written Motion regarding placing his client on the Sex Offender Registry. State objects to the motion and presents arguments. Court denied the the Motion. Defense counsel is requesting the court to change the time frame as to the length of him being on the Registry. State presents arguments and believes the court does not have the discretion  to change the 15 year time frame.  Court declines the request.

IT IS ORDERED that the appeal is dismissed pursuant to Wis. Stat. Rule 809.18.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion under Wis. Stat. Rule 809.30, is extended to February 25, 2016.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Britton R Saunders in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. State makes sentencing recommendations. Victim's mother makes statements. Victim's father makes statements. Attorney Patrickus makes sentencing recommendations. Dr. John O'Donnell makes statements on behalf of the Defense. Defendant's Father makes statement's. Attorney Patrickus makes further statements. Defendant makes statements. Court sentences the Defendant to the following.

COUNT#1: 

WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  5 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victim listed in the Criminal Complaint, or their family.
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
____No unsupervised contact with anyone under 18 without Agent approval
____Sex offender registration
____Participate in sex offender treatment
____No possession of pornography or any other explicit materials
____No access to any computer or device with internet access without prior approval from Agent

RESTITUTION:  $80.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge. (to be paid as a condition of probation)

COUNT#2:

WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  5 YEARS   ***CONCURRENT TO COUNT #1***

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victim listed in the Criminal Complaint, or their family.
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
____No unsupervised contact with anyone under 18 without Agent approval
____Sex offender registration
____Participate in sex offender treatment
____No possession of pornography or any other explicit materials
____No access to any computer or device with internet access without prior approval from Agent

COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant

COUNT#3:
___6 Months Jail (Straight time, sentence to commence forthwith) (CREDIT - 5 days)

COUNT#4:
___6 Month Jail (Straight time) ***CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #3***  ***CORRECTED ON 11/05/15***
